response.answer_text: No, there’s no such thing as 4G wifi. 4G is a cellular data standard. WiFi is a non-cellular wireless data standard. Now, if your real intent is to ask do 5G Phones support 4G and WiFi. Yes, they do, and they’ll even do 3G and 2G. It’s simple and easy to support the older modems in a fall back mode, should you be in remote areas where networks simply haven’t been upgraded. Yes, I’ve been on GSM Edge in places as recently as this year which is a 2G data network technology.

Q: Do 5g phones support 4G wifi? There is no such thing as “4G WiFi”. 5G and 4G are part of the cellular interface between the phone and the cellular network. WiFi is an alternative interface to using a wired connection to other local devices such as a home router. WiFi does not come over the cellular network, nor down it come over a normal home ISP connection. The exact specification of WiFi, such as the particular 802.11 specification and 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz networks is not related to 4G or 5G.
